description: In a new lawsuit, the Justice Department claims Alabama violated federal law by systematically removing voters fewer than 90 days before a federal election.
title: Justice Department sues Alabama, claiming it purged voters too close to the election

description: The worst floods that Bangladesh has seen in decades occurred in August, displacing millions. Many people are still struggling to rebuild their lives and find sources of income.
title: Severe floods causing health problems in south Bangladesh

description: The electronic music producer’s family and collaborators spent three years completing the album SOPHIE with the pieces she left behind after her death.
title: How do you finish a visionary artist’s final album?

description: In The Listeners, a seductive cult leader and an unexplainable noise divides an innocent community and warps reality. Mazzoli's opera receives its U.S. premiere in Philadelphia.
title: A mysterious hum and a charismatic leader stoke chaos in Missy Mazzoli's opera

description: The self-described “surreal blues poet” savors the significance of words and the noisy poetry of city life.
title: Words, sounds and the art of listening with Aja Monet

description: Japan's ruling party on Friday picked former defense minister Shigeru Ishiba as leader, setting him up to become prime minister next week.
title: Former Defense Minister Ishiba will become Japan's Prime Minister next week
